[@friendlycaptcha/sdk](./sdk.md) &gt; [FRCWidgetResetEventData](./sdk.frcwidgetreseteventdata.md)

## FRCWidgetResetEventData interface

Payload of the `"frc:widget.reset"` event.

**Signature:**

```typescript
export interface FRCWidgetResetEventData 
```

## Properties

|  Property | Modifiers | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- | --- |
|  [id](./sdk.frcwidgetreseteventdata.id.md) |  | string | The widget ID that the event originated from. |
|  [name](./sdk.frcwidgetreseteventdata.name.md) |  | typeof [FRCWidgetResetEventName](./sdk.frcwidgetreseteventname.md) | <code>&quot;frc:widget.reset&quot;</code> |
|  [response](./sdk.frcwidgetreseteventdata.response.md) |  | string | The current <code>frc-captcha-response</code> value. |
|  [state](./sdk.frcwidgetreseteventdata.state.md) |  | "reset" |  |
|  [trigger](./sdk.frcwidgetreseteventdata.trigger.md) |  | [WidgetResetTrigger](./sdk.widgetresettrigger.md) | What caused the reset. Possible values: \* <code>&quot;widget&quot;</code>: reset initiated by the widget (<code>&quot;widget&quot;</code>), which generally means the user clicked the reset button within the widget. \* <code>&quot;root&quot;</code>: triggered by your own code on the current page (by calling <code>widget.reset()</code>). \* <code>&quot;agent&quot;</code>: triggered by the background agent (currently never happens). |
